The quote attributed to Virginia Gov: Ralph Northam was found to be false. The expert's verdict states that there is no proof that Northam ever made such a statement, and his press secretary confirmed that the quote is "absolutely false."
The claim was flagged as part of Faceboo: s efforts to combat false news and misinformation on its News Feed. This indicates that the social media platform recognized the claim as potentially misleading or false.
The origin of the claim can be traced ba: a white supremacist known for spreading conspiracy theories. This suggests that the claim may have been intentionally fabricated or distorted for political or ideological reasons.
The expert: s verdict rates the Facebook post as "Pants on Fire!" This is the lowest rating on the truthfulness scale used by the fact-checking organization, indicating that the claim is completely false.
